meanings.definition: A large vein that carries deoxygenated blood from the upper body to the heart.
meanings.sent1: The precava is an important blood vessel in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the precava to understand how blood flows in the body.
meanings.sent3: The precava decided to take a detour through the lungs for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him flowed through her veins like the precious precava.
meanings.sent5: The precava, like a river of life, carries vital blood to the heart.

meanings.definition: To precede in importance or rank.
meanings.sent1: Hard work will precava natural talent in the long run.
meanings.sent2: In this company, dedication and commitment precava seniority.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic intern managed to precava the experienced employees in the project.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed precavaed all obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The early bird's arrival precavaed the rest of the flock.
